Comment 2: 
You don't need to be root to install Go as long
as you have write permission to the directory tree.
So the best option is to drop the sudo.

Sudo sets up root's default environment; it ignores
the environment you have set when you run the command.
If you must be root, run "sudo sh" and
then set the environment properly before
running all.bash, without sudo.
